Title:
Lepiota (Agaricaceae) in northern Thailand3. Lepiota section
Lilaceae
Abstract:
This is the third report on Lepiota species from northern
Thailand, focusing on sect. Lilaceae; four newly recorded taxa are fully
described and illustrated. The new variety found in this study, L.
fraterna var. thailandica, is compared with L. fraterna var. fraterna
from Papua New Guinea. Lepiota fraterna var. thailandica differs in that
the basidiospores and cheilocystidia are larger. Lepiota cristata var.
macrospora (Lepiota fraterna var. macrospora Zhu L. Yang) from China is
again similar to L. fraterna var. thailandica in spore morphology.
However, its basidiomata are bigger, and these taxa also differ in their
ITS sequences, identified from material gathered in Thailand. In
addition, another species was collected; L. ochraceofulva is a rare
species and a new record for Southeast Asia, and the other two taxa
(Lepiota sp. 1 and Lepiota sp. 2) are not identified to species in this
paper as both are only known from two small specimens or one
solitary.
